headline: Xos launches 2026 Electric Class 6 Chassis, starting at just $99,000
summary: Performance proven market leader delivers electric platform with more deployed vehicles, more real-world miles, and more blue-chip fleet customers in the US than any competitor.The Xos stripped chassis now starts at the most competitive price in the industry. headline: Veho to flex delivery speed for price-sensitive e-commerce sellers
summary: Veho is offering e-commerce shippers a way to reduce costs so they can offer free shipping if they are willing to accept day-range certainty instead of a day-definite delivery, in effort to differentiate themselves from other independent parcel carriers. The post Veho to flex delivery speed for price-sensitive e-commerce sellers appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Toptal Ranked #1 Most Reliable Professional Services Company in America by Newsweek
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 03, 2026--Toptal, the world’s largest fully remote workforce, has been ranked the #1 most reliable professional services company in America on the America’s Most Reliable Companies 2026 list by Newsweek and Statista. The list ranks top US companies based on trust, dependability, and consistent performance in their industry.

headline: UPS expands RFID deployment to woo shippers, up productivity
summary: The carrier's UPS Store locations are now processing 1.3 million packages with the technology daily as retailers seek improved shipment visibility.

headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From United Parcel Service’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: United Parcel Service’s fourth quarter results were met positively by the market, with leadership crediting disciplined cost management, revenue quality initiatives, and automation investments as key contributors. CEO Carol Tomé emphasized that all segments contributed to outperformance, driven by network reconfiguration and the deliberate reduction of Amazon-related volume.
